articles.author: Will Ziebell
articles.title: Australian government deploys army reservists, third navy ship to support firefighters
articles.description: The Australian government said on Saturday that up to 3,000 army reservists would be deployed to help communities hit by spreading wildfires and a third navy ship had been readied to support evacuations from coastal towns.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE (Reuters) - The Australian government said on Saturday that up to 3,000 army reservists would be deployed to help communities hit by spreading wildfires and a third navy ship had been readied to support evacuations from coastal towns. 
It is the fi… [+2022 chars]

articles.author: Yereth Rosen
articles.title: Rumbling Alaska volcano sends ash plume 5 miles into the air
articles.description: One of Alaska’s most active volcanoes, a towering ice-covered cone in the Aleutian Islands, shot a cloud of ash more than 5 miles (8 km) high on Friday, triggering a warning to aviators and putting on a show that was captured in satellite imagery.
articles.content: ANCHORAGE, Alaska (Reuters) - One of Alaska’s most active volcanoes, a towering ice-covered cone in the Aleutian Islands, shot a cloud of ash more than 5 miles (8 km) high on Friday, triggering a warning to aviators and putting on a show that was captured in … [+1415 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Hudson's Bay agrees to be taken private for C$11 a share
articles.description: Saks Fifth Avenue owner Hudson's Bay Co has agreed with a group pf shareholders to be taken private in a deal under which the company will buy stocks held by certain minority stakeholders for C$11 ($8.46) apiece in cash.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Saks Fifth Avenue owner Hudson’s Bay Co (HBC.TO) has agreed with a group pf shareholders to be taken private in a deal under which the company will buy stocks held by certain minority stakeholders for C$11 ($8.46) apiece in cash.

articles.author: Prak Chan Thul
articles.title: Ten dead in Cambodia building collapse, more trapped
articles.description: At least 10 people were killed and 23 injured after a building in Cambodia collapsed, trapping workers under rubble, officials said on Saturday.
articles.content:
PHNOM PENH (Reuters) - At least 10 people were killed and 23 injured after a building in Cambodia collapsed, trapping workers under rubble, officials said on Saturday. 
The seven-storey concrete building collapsed on Friday in the coastal town of Kep, about … [+1106 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: NBA notebook: Band on uniforms to honor Stern
articles.description: NBA players and referees will wear a commemorative black band on their uniforms honoring former commissioner David Stern, who died Wednesday.
articles.content:
NBA players and referees will wear a commemorative black band on their uniforms honoring former commissioner David Stern, who died Wednesday. 
The league said Friday the bands will be worn throughout the rest of the 2019-20 season, including the playoffs.

articles.title: NFL notebook: Vikings’ Zimmer, GM get vote of confidence

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Australia Prime Minister defers visits to India, Japan amid bushfire emergency
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has canceled official trips to India and Japan that were scheduled for the second half of January as he battles a bushfire emergency at home.
articles.content:
MELBOURNE (Reuters) - Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison has canceled official trips to India and Japan that were scheduled for the second half of January as he battles a bushfire emergency at home.
